alert.note: Alert for Hancock; Harrison; Jackson (Mississippi) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued December 30 at 9:54AM CST by NWS New Orleans
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of Harrison, east central Hancock and Jackson Counties through 1100 AM CST... At 954 AM CST, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Lyman, or near Gulfport, moving east at 35 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Gulfport, Biloxi, Ocean Springs, Long Beach, Moss Point, Bay St. Louis, Waveland, St. Martin, Escatawpa, Diamondhead, Gautier, D`iberville, Wade, Latimer, Big Point, Lyman, Saucier, Helena, Gulf Hills and Hurley. This includes the following Interstates... Interstate 10 in Mississippi between mile markers 17 and 76. Interstate 110 in Mississippi between mile markers 1 and 4. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
